ca.uqac.lif.cep.peg.weka

Class WekaUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.peg.weka.WekaUtils

  • public class WekaUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    A set of utility methods for manipulating Weka objects.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  WekaUtils.CastClassifierToFunction
      Wraps its argument (a Weka Classifier object) into a BeepBeep WekaUtils.ClassifierFunction.
      static class  WekaUtils.ClassifierFunction
      A Weka Classifier object wrapped into a BeepBeep Function.
      static class  WekaUtils.GetGraph 
      static class  WekaUtils.MergeIntoArray
      Special-purpose function that merges a scalar value x and a collection y of size n and a* scalar value x into an array of size n+1 where x is placed at the last position.

    • Method Detail

      • createAttribute

        public static weka.core.Attribute createAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                                                  java.lang.String... values)
        Creates a discrete attribute by giving its name and the list of possible values. This is a utility method meant to simplify the creation of discrete attributes, which is a bit verbose when directly using Weka's objects and methods.
        Parameters:
        name - The attribute's name
        values - The possible values for the attribute
        Returns:

      • createInstanceFromArray

        public static weka.core.Instance createInstanceFromArray(weka.core.Instances dataset,
                                                         java.lang.Object[] array,
                                                         weka.core.Attribute... attributes)
        Creates an Instance from an array of values
        Parameters:
        dataset - The dataset linked to this instance
        array - The array of values. The array can contain null elements; these will be interpreted as missing values.
        Returns:
        The Instance

      • getClassValue

        public static java.lang.String getClassValue(double d,
                                             weka.core.Attribute... attributes)
        Gets the name of a class based on its index. By default, a Weka Classifier returns a double value when given an instance; this value corresponds to the index of the value in the attribute's list of possible values.
        Parameters:
        d - The number returned by the classifier for a given instance
        attributes - The list of attributes used by the classifier. The class attribute is taken to be the last argument.
        Returns:
        The name of the class. The value null may be returned if the position d does not correspond to a valid index for the class attribute.

      • createArray

        public static java.lang.Object[] createArray(java.lang.Object x,
                                             java.lang.Object y)
        Special-purpose function that merges a scalar value x and a collection y of size n and a* scalar value x into an array of size n+1 where x is placed at the last position.
        Parameters:
        x - The scalar value
        y - The array

      • createInstances

        public static weka.core.Instances createInstances(java.lang.String dataset_name,
                                                  int capacity,
                                                  weka.core.Attribute... attributes)
        Creates a Weka Instances object for use with a classifier.
        Parameters:
        dataset_name - The name of the dataset
        capacity - A capacity for the Instances object
        attributes - THe list of attributes to use in this dataset
        Returns:
        The correctly instantiated Instances object

      • getClassifier

        public static weka.classifiers.Classifier getClassifier(java.lang.String name)
        Gets a "vanilla" instance of a classifier object based on its generic name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the classifier
        Returns:
        An instance of the classifier, or null if the given name does not correspond to a supported classifier.

      • countInstances

        public static int countInstances(weka.core.Instances i)
        Counts the instances in a dataset
        Parameters:
        i - The dataset
        Returns:
        The number of instances

      • isEqual

        public static boolean isEqual(weka.core.Instance x,
                              weka.core.Instance y,
                              weka.core.Attribute... attributes)
        Determines if two instances are equal according to a list of attributes
        Parameters:
        x - The first instance
        y - The second instance
        attributes - The list of attributes
        Returns:
        true if the instances are equal, false otherwise
